comment: I never had any issue with Houde. She was always willing to help out and take time out of lab to go over the lecture if students needed it. There are some grades dropped and few chances for extra credit. The hardest part about the class is the lab flow entries because the system grades super hard.

Prof Houde was nice and a lenient grader. Lab reports are all done on Labflow, so be sure to double check everything before submitting. She gives you all of the calculations you need to know and goes over everything before the lab. She also drops 2 of the lowest quizzes and 2 lab reports. Final was easy compared to ACS final

Professor Houde was great, she is a caring woman and will help you if you show a genuine interest in the class. She is a very knowledgeable person and if you get behind in a lecture or don't understand something in there she will help you. Accent can throw some people off but she is sweet and caring and will help you during lab if you ask

I took Houde for both 1211 and 1212 lab. She is nice but can be quick to call you out if you mess something up small during lab. Labs were graded off of lab flow which is annoying because lab flow does not allow leeway. overall the class wasnt too bad. Shes pretty fair. The only thing is she takes a while to grade things.

She was fine, typical lab class especially since most grades were determined through Labflow, only big issue I had were was that she wouldn't respond or would be really late to emails. But I liked how she dropped some assignments.

I was disappointed in the chem lab program in its entirety. When I took this class, we had to use labflow, a platform that would constantly mess up your numbers in lab reports. pre-lab quizzes for every lab on the lab instructions were also difficult. Houde is tough to reach outside of class, and grades at a glacial pace, but decent overall.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Professor Houde is absolutely amazing, Chemistry is difficult, but she really tries to break it down to make it understanding. The curriculum is quiz heavy, but she drops a few grades. If you miss ANY labs, you will not get an A . The tests were relatively easy but only if you pay attention, thick accent but you get used to it. ASK QUESTIONS!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: One of the best teachers I have ever had. She is so helpful even-though classes were virtual. She is great at explaining material and her accent does not really hinder her ability to teach. She was always there outside of class to teach. I would definitely recommend taking her

This class was very difficult for me. Professor Houde is a tough grader on lab assignments and notebooks. The weekly quizzes consist of nothing you have learned before class so they are very difficult to pass. She has an accent which makes it hard to understand somethings when she explains the lab. Very little guidance from her throughout class.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Mrs. Houde was honestly a great professor. She has an accent, but as time goes on you get used to it and it isn't a problem. She's very strict about lab notebooks, but once you get it done right they are so easy. I really liked her and If I needed any help she helped me. I'm taking her for my next chemistry lab too.

Do NOT take Houde. She singles you out if you do one thing wrong and is very unprofessional. She waited until halfway through the semester to start putting in grades. Very strict grading on lab notebook. Labs are long and she doesn't explain them well. She doesn't help on labs done at home. Have heard many other horror stories about her.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: honestly if you do the work you'll pass even if you're not good at chemistry.

She's not a bad teacher but she is very bad at explaining what needs to be done for class. The first week for our journals almost no one had them done right as she didn't give clear instructions on how to do the right. She also has very little resources on her d2l to help you with, on top of being very hard to reach outside of class.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: I loved Professor Houde! She made difficult labs way easier to understand. If you ask for help or get confused, she will help you until you understand where you went wrong or what you missed. She is a lenient grader and genuinely cares for her students! She has an accent, but you get used to it over time. Definitely would take her again.
This was the easiest lab I've taken. She is a very easy grader on the lab reports and is very knowledgable about the labs
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: SHE IS GREAT! I had her for lab, and she explains each lab before you begin (you just need to ask). Her grading is chill for lab reports, but if you have questions she is very good at explaining. The labs can be finished early if you find the right lab partner, and IF your lab notebook is filled out CORRECTLY. Great professor, great course.

DO NOT take her..... Trust me when I say this I havent met a professor who majority of the class hates. She will kick you out of class if you dont have the procedure written down or have your lab notebook. 1 credit class with 3 credits worth of work.

Prof. Houde was awesome. Her grading was very clear and she helped you if you got stuck. She wasn't very accessible outside of class but was very helpful in class. She was very lenient on grading the lab reports. Overall a sweet lady.
Dr. Houde has a tough time explaining things, but she cares a lot about you and your grade.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: She was a great chem 1212 lab professor. She graded the labs leniently and wanted you to really understand what you missed on past labs. She went over the lab before it started but still made us work to figure out how to do some parts. Such a nice lady and great professor!
Just like any class you must apply yourself, but your grade will reflect the work you put in fairly. She was a great Chem 1211 lab professor.

She is one of the most lenient lab professors, and she is an easy grader. She writes everything you need to know for the labs on the board for us to take pictures of. You'll get used to her accent pretty quick, I rarely misunderstood her. I would have made an A in the class, but the lab final was beyond difficult to me.

I think people were a little harsh on here, honestly. It's a tough lab, as it /is/ applied Chemistry. So the homework is a little tough and can be confusing. She's hard to reach outside of class, but is happy to spend time before or after class helping you. If you're honest with her about problems and what's going on, she's so kind and helpful.

Houde is an okay professor. He accent is kind of hard to understand but she is willing to work with you if you don't understand. Be sure to take advantage of all easy A's in the class because the final is a KILLER!

She is a good teacher inside the lab, but  there is no contact outside of lab. She doesn't reply to emails. She has an accent, but its not too heavy and becomes easier to understand as the year goes on.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I end up explaining how molarity works to her just about every lab. My grade is an A, and I would give her a solid C at best. If you want a lab where the teacher can not explain how to do the math, then take her by all means.

Professor Houde is awesome and she's such a sweet lady! She's a little hard to understand but she will spend time with you until you understand her. You can ask her for help with anything and she will get you through the lab. As long as you follow the lab rules and show up prepared, she will make it as easy as possible for you!
